etymology.interpretation: Depicts a belt woven from cloth, highlighting its textile nature. Over time the form was stylized, but it still evokes something that wraps around or is worn at the waist.
etymology.simplification: Simplified from 帶 to 带 by streamlining the complex woven components and retaining the cloth element (巾), reducing strokes for easier writing while preserving the core idea.

examples.chinese: 他系上皮带出门(他繫上皮帶出門)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xì shàng pí dài chū mén.
examples.english: He fastened his belt before going out.

examples.chinese: 这条河两岸是湿地带(這條河兩岸是濕地帶)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tiáo hé liǎng'àn shì shī dìdài.
examples.english: The banks of this river are a wetland zone.

examples.chinese: 出门别忘了带雨伞(出門別忘了帶雨傘)。
examples.pinyin: Chū mén bié wàng le dài yǔsǎn.
examples.english: Don’t forget to bring an umbrella when going out.
